Package com.shouldis.bitset

Class Matrix

java.lang.Object
com.shouldis.bitset.Matrix
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public final class Matrix
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
64 by 64 bit matrix backed by either a BitSet, ConcurrentBitSet or ImmutableBitSet.
Author:
Aaron Shouldis
See Also:
Serialized Form

    The BitSet storing the bits contained in this BitSet.

    Resolves an x-coordinate and a y-coordinate to a bit index.
    static int wrap​(int coordinate)

  • Field Details

    • serialVersionUID

      private static final long serialVersionUID
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • MATRIX_SIZE

      public static final int MATRIX_SIZE
      The number of bits contained in a Matrix.

    • bits

      private final BitSet bits
      The BitSet storing the bits contained in this BitSet. (X, Y) coordinates are mapped to indices through index(int, int).

  • Constructor Details

    • Matrix

      private Matrix​(BitSet bits)
      Internal, private constructor.
      Parameters:
      bits - the BitSet to initialize this Matrix with.
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException - if bits is null.

  • Method Details

    • create

      public static Matrix create()
      Creates a Matrix backed by a BitSet with size equal to MATRIX_SIZE. All bits are initialized to the dead state.
      Returns:
      the created Matrix.

    • create

      public static Matrix create​(Matrix matrix)
      Creates a Matrix backed by a BitSet with size equal to MATRIX_SIZE. All bits copy the state of the bits in the specified Matrix matrix.
      Parameters:
      matrix - the Matrix to copy.
      Returns:
      the created Matrix copy of matrix.

    • createConcurrent

      public static Matrix createConcurrent()
      Creates a Matrix backed by a ConcurrentBitSet with size equal to MATRIX_SIZE. All bits are initialized to the dead state.
      Returns:
      the created Matrix.

    • createConcurrent

      public static Matrix createConcurrent​(Matrix matrix)
      Creates a Matrix backed by a ConcurrentBitSet with size equal to MATRIX_SIZE. All bits copy the state of the bits in the specified Matrix matrix.
      Parameters:
      matrix - the Matrix to copy.
      Returns:
      the created Matrix copy of matrix.

    • createImmutable

      public static Matrix createImmutable​(Matrix matrix)
      Creates a Matrix backed by an ImmutableBitSet with size equal to MATRIX_SIZE. All bits copy the state of the bits in the specified Matrix matrix.
      Parameters:
      matrix - the Matrix to copy.
      Returns:
      the created Matrix copy of matrix.

    • createInline

      public static Matrix createInline()
      Creates a Matrix backed by a InlineBitSet with size equal to MATRIX_SIZE. All bits are initialized to the dead state.
      Returns:
      the created Matrix.

    • createInline

      public static Matrix createInline​(Matrix matrix)
      Creates a Matrix backed by a InlineBitSet with size equal to MATRIX_SIZE. All bits copy the state of the bits in the specified Matrix matrix.
      Parameters:
      matrix - the Matrix to copy.
      Returns:
      the created Matrix copy of matrix.

    • x

      public static int x​(int index)
      Resolves the x-coordinate corresponding to the specified index. If the index is out of the [0, MATRIX_SIZE), the result is undefined.
      Parameters:
      index - the bit index to map to an x-coordinate.
      Returns:
      the x-coordinate representation of index.

    • y

      public static int y​(int index)
      Resolves the y-coordinate corresponding to the specified index. If the index is out of the range [0, MATRIX_SIZE), the result is undefined.
      Parameters:
      index - the bit index to map to an y-coordinate.
      Returns:
      the y-coordinate representation of index.

    • index

      public static int index​(int x, int y)
      Resolves an x-coordinate and a y-coordinate to a bit index.
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate to resolve to a bit index.
      y - the y-coordinate to resolve to a bit index.
      Returns:
      the bit index representing the specified x and y coordinate.

    • wrapIndex

      public static int wrapIndex​(int x, int y)
      Resolves an x-coordinate and a y-coordinate to a bit index through wrapping. wrap(int) is used to bound the coordinates in the range [0, Long.SIZE) as if this Matrix was a torus.
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate to resolve to a bit index.
      y - the y-coordinate to resolve to a bit index.
      Returns:
      the bit index representing the specified x and y coordinate after using wrap(int).

    • wrap

      public static int wrap​(int coordinate)
      Resolves an x-coordinate or y-coordinate to a x-coordinate or y-coordinate bounding it within the range [0, Long.SIZE) as if this Matrix was a torus.
      Parameters:
      coordinate - the coordinate to bound within the range [0, Long.SIZE).
      Returns:
      coordinate after being bound within the range [0, Long.SIZE).

    • bits

      public BitSet bits()
      Returns a reference to the BitSet backing this Matrix. If createConcurrent() or createConcurrent(Matrix) were used to create this Matrix, a ConcurrentBitSet will be returned.
      Returns:
      the BitSet representing the bits of this Matrix.

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()
      Overrides:
      hashCode in class java.lang.Object

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object obj)
      Overrides:
      equals in class java.lang.Object
